wikipedia_page.main: Sir David Campbell MC FRSE (1889–1978) was a Scottish physician and pharmacologist. He was Professor of Materia Medica at Aberdeen University from 1930 to 1959. He won the Military Cross in 1918 due to his bravery serving in the Royal Army Medical Corps.

response: *David Campbell, Professor of Materia Medica at Aberdeen University from 1930 to 1959. Won the Military Cross in 1918 due to his bravery serving in the Royal Army Medical Corps.
*Sir David Campbell MC FRSE (1889-1978) was born and raised in Patna.
* Professor David Campbell  President of the General Medical Council

In 1964 he was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society of Edinburgh. His proposers were Matthew Sydney Thomson, Cecil Wakeley, David Campbell, Sir Stanley Davidson, George Lightbody Montgomery, and John Stirling Young.
